content: do we have a part of the style guide about whether subscripts should be used? it seems to be that they are almost always preferred, but I can't find any documentation on this (https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22361/files#r2061272053)

I think it’s pretty uncontroversial: subscript such as σ₁ instead of σ1 are much nicer. But maybe nobody ever thought of writing it in the style guide. In that case feel free to open a PR to the style guide.

My impression is that Patrick's opinion (which I definitely agree with) is not universally shared by the CS community. Indeed I've even heard people in CS pushing back against unicode on the basis that it obfuscates; conversely I've heard people in the maths community saying that Lean's unicode is what attracted them to Lean over the other provers (where it's far less prevalent).
Sure. We’re talking about Mathlib here. I’m not saying everybody on Earth loves unicode subscript numbers.
In which case, yes we definitely prefer h₁ to h1 etc.
